title: BostonU Trojan Detection Container.
technique: BostonU XGBoost Regressor w/ attribution features
technique_description: Given a pdf feature input and a model, we use attribution (= input  * gradient of the loss w.r.t input) as the features for trojan detection. If there exists n pdf feature inputs, a model can produce n attribution features. The detector will make n predictions. The mean of the prediction will be used as the final prediction. The trojan detector is a xgboost regressor. Hyperparameter tuning and k-folds are adopted to find the best hyperparameters

num_data_per_model.description: How many attribution feature vectors each model produce. No higher than the number of pdf inputs in the model's folder

train_data_augmentation.description: The times that the data are repeatedly processed.

train_weight_table_random_state.description: Random state for weight table during training.

train_weight_table_params_mean.description: Mean of the normal distribution used for the weight table.

train_weight_table_params_std.description: Standard deviation of the normal distribution used for the weight table.

train_weight_table_params_scaler.description: Multiply all items of the weight table by this number (float).
